Join us to embark on a lifestyle changing career. October 1, 2013 (Tuesday) Omni Chicago Hotel676 North Michigan AvenueChicago, IL  60611 Presentations will begin at: 10am OR 3pm Interviews will immediately follow. We are currently searching for Food & Beverage positions based onboard our ship on the seas of HawaiiBAR WAITER POSITION SUMMARYResponsible for beverage service and sales in the workstation that is assigned to him/her in the public bar or lounge. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS     Responsible for promoting and maximizing beverage sales in the assigned workplace, while following & ensuring that all company beverage service standards are being adhered to.Follows company guidelines regarding uniform, personal grooming & hygiene.Ensures that company policy in regards to drinking age is followed, & practices responsible service of alcoholic beverages.Helps maintain the bar & pantry areas at all times in accordance with USPH / FDA and SEMS rules and regulations, including  following guidelines relating to the correct use & maintenance of all bar equipment.Ensures the assigned workstation is properly set & prepared to meet the daily business demands.Provides prompt, attentive, consistent & courteous service to every guest in the assigned workstation, & through this helps to achieve the yearly goal for the bar scores in the guest comment cards.Strives to always up-sell to better quality premium & super-premium products, & is able to recommend & suggest beverages when guests ask for assistance in selecting them.Effectively communicates any problem, challenges, complaints or service difficulties in a timely manner to the Bartender on duty or immediate supervisor. Maintains an attentive & proactive approach offering consecutive rounds of drinks, asserting satisfaction with the product served.Responsible for the correct registering & proper handling of all individual checks & sales transactions generated in the assigned workstation.Performs other duties assigned by the Bartender / Supervisor on duty.Must be familiar with the Safety and Environmental Protection policy and SEMS; carry out the policies and procedures appropriate for his/her position.Perform other duties as assigned.ASSISTANT WAITERPOSITION SUMMARYAssists a Waiter in the service of an assigned work station in a restaurant and/or works in a buffet area, making sure that guests are provided consistently with courteous, prompt and efficient service done according to company standards. In order to consistently exceed guest expectations and provide the highest levels of product and services, additional duties and responsibilities may be assigned as needed.   ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSResponsible for assisting in achieving the departments guest satisfaction targets and the food and beverage revenues determined by the Company for the restaurant organization.Follows at all times company service standards and sequences of service for breakfast, lunch, dinner and buffets.Complies with all company policies, rules and regulations.Resolves in a satisfactory and proactive manner all service and product deficiencies in his/her station and reports any incidents or challenges to the Waiter.Checks with every guest, during each meal period, to ascertain satisfaction with service and food.Follows and is compliant with all Public Health rules and regulations.Follows instructions from the Waiter in order to ensure timeliness of service to guests.Ensures that his/her workstation is properly set-up for each meal period and that the mise-en-place is appropriate for the expected level of business.Ensures that his/her work station is properly cleaned and re-set at the end of each meal period.Follows schedules, work assignments and executes the side jobs that are determined by management and Waiters.JOB REQUIREMENTSYou must have a minimum of 1 year current/recent/relevant experience to any of the positions listed in our description above.You must have a minimum of a high school diploma or GEDYou must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and qualify for a U.S. Coast Guard Merchant Mariner Credential (MMC).You must be at least 18 years of age.You must Pass Physical Exam/Drug Screen.You must have a Reasonably Clear Background.You must be able to read, write and speak English fluently.

full_description: On behalf of Research Triangle Institute, Headway Workforce Solutions is currently seekingPart-Time Field Interviewers for a government sponsored research study in Chicago, IL. Candidates can live in any of the following counties: Cook, Du Page, Will, Kane, McHenry, Lake.  POSITION SUMMARYRTI International is seeking part time field staff for the Evaluation of the Public Education Campaign on Teen Tobacco (ExPECTT), sponsored by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration’s Center for Tobacco Products.  Field Interviewers will be responsible for traveling to participant’s homes in assigned areas and conducting research interviews with eligible youth between the ages of 11 and 16.  Additional work may be available as part of future phases of the study.    POSITION TYPE This position is part time, offering roughly 25 – 30 hours/week. This position is scheduled to last for approximately 3 months, beginning in late October or early November. We are looking for individuals who will be able to work evening and weekend hours, maintain a varied schedule, and travel locally. Qualified Candidates will be able to commit to the duration of the project.  JOB REQUIREMENTS ·         Be available for at least 20-25 hours per week to conduct interviewing during the field period data collection period.·         Have reliable personal automobile available for business use.·         Be available and willing to work evenings and weekend hours as required by your specific assignment.·         Complete the required number of interviews by the end of the data collection period in an efficient and timely manner. ·        Conduct valid, high quality in-person screenings/interviews in compliance with all project protocols covered at training and documented in the project manual.·         Obtain cooperation of study participants by effectively answering questions and addressing concerns.·         Accurately complete all project documentation, including electronic survey instruments and all reporting forms. ·         Adhere to project deadlines for completing interviews, reporting progress and returning materials and equipment.  ·         Keep project information confidential.·         Ability to carry project-related equipment, approximately 15 pounds.·         Ability to complete all required activities in a professional manner, while maintaining the integrity of all information acquired. ·    Maintain a professional, cooperative relationship with your Field Supervisor and other project staff, objectively sharing your thoughts while displaying an understanding of project management’s concerns.·         Be receptive—not defensive—when given feedback from project personnel about your performance, striving to learn and improve.·         Prompt, reliable and accurate reporting to Field Supervisor.·         Must have regular access to an analog phone line or internet connection for data transmissions TRAININGField Interviewers will be expected to attend an out of town in –person paid training, which is tentatively scheduled for late-October or early November. Attendance at training is mandatory. Trainees must successfully complete training to continue employment on the project. This position will offer an average of $ 12.50 per hour.  For immediate consideration please apply by visiting:  https://www.appone.com/MainInfoReq.asp?R_ID=730356 Headway is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

full_description:
The Job:           

		To achieve and, ideally, exceed company and hotel targets arising from the company core objectives and values, e.g. Guest Relations, Employee Relations, Costs & Efficiency, and Sales and Revenue.
	
		To be fully accountable for the people, product and profit within the hotel.
	
		To deliver excellence in customer service, as well as, exploit opportunities for growth within the business.
	
		To ensure the company culture is visible in all aspects of the business.

	 

	The Business:    

		Adhere to company reporting systems.
	
		Ensure all hotel policies, standards and local laws are followed.
	
		Ensure kitchen and Health Department sanitation requirements are maintained at all times.
	
		Ensure that food waste, loss and usage adhere to company guidelines and procedures.
	
		Assist in establishing procedures to adjust any food-cost related issues.

	 

	The People:

		Behave at all times based on a customer responsive culture where exceptional customer service prevails.
	
		Act as an ambassador and protector of the brand.  Keep the brand and the company culture prominent and consistent at all levels, in the back and front of the house areas
	
		Possess attentive, accountable and highly organization skills with the ability to plan multiple activities and meet deadlines.
	
		Exemplify excellent interpersonal and communication skills by possessing admirable telephone etiquette, customer service orientation and the ability to act proactively in all situations.
	
		Exceed expectations through the ability to personify friendliness, engagement, and act graciously with the ability to focus and connect with all guests, and employees, at all levels.
	
		Consistently demonstrate an upbeat, energetic, authentic and professional attitude at all times.
	
		Instinctively create memorable experiences for all guests that can be credited as both genuine and thoughtful by empowering co-workers to strive for success. 
	
		Promote teamwork and foster a harmonious working environment through the demonstration of the ability to work alone, without direct supervision and by meeting the requests and demands of a direct supervisor.
	
		Assist other departments when needed.

	 

	The Product:

		Maintain and develop brand values and operational core standards to ensure that the hotel is always well-presented.
	
		Ensure that all guests are utilizing the hotel facilities and are completely satisfied with the belief that they have received an excellent value for their money.
	
		Develop relationships with all guests, group contacts, and neighbors to provide personalized service. Ensure that we treat our guests as we would in our own home.
	
		Ensure the ultimate guest satisfaction by demonstrating the ability to resolve guest complaints and respond to guest requests in a positive, timely, and appropriate fashion with the highest level of hospitality and professionalism. In addition to accommodating special requests whenever possible to produce a memorable experience.
	
		Undertake regular internal inspections to ensure company’s assets are well maintained and protected.
	
		Ensure that the preparations of all food items are according to the guest orders and remain consistent with quality by following recipe cards, in addition to, production, portion and presentation fundamentals.
	
		Constantly provide a voice and act as a team member by consistently making recommendations on how to improve service and products to produce an operation that continues to exceed expectations.
	
		Assist team members by completing mis-en-placing and setting up work stations for breakfast, lunch and dinner through the preparation and inspection of various varieties of meat, seafood, and poultry, while ensuring that items are not prepared beyond estimate needs and meet established specifications.
	
		Maintain kitchen cleanliness and organization by dating food containers, monitoring food rotation to make sure it adheres to company policies, checking pars for shift usage, of-sock items, and possible shortages, and ensure that all unused items are returned to their designated storage areas.

	 

	The Rest:

		Hold at least two years culinary experience, or in a related field, with knowledge of all departments internally.
	
		Protect the name of the hotel and company and ensure that no actions are taken within, or in the name of, the hotel that could bring the Company into disrepute.
	
		Take action in all matters related to the safety, security, satisfaction and the well-being of company and hotel employees, hotel guests and the property by responding swiftly and effectively in any hotel emergency. 
	
		Assure the proper handling of VIPs through the protection of their privacy and confidentiality.
	
		Ensure compliance to all hotel policies and procedures at all levels.
	
		Maintain an innovative technical expertise through the attendance of professional meetings and review of current literature and trends.
	
		Obtain any required food handling or sanitation certifications that are required by local or state agencies.
	
		All other responsibilities assigned by Management. 

	 

	The Educational Requirements:   

		Minimum of two years of culinary, or related, experience with advanced culinary knowledge.
	
		Cooking school or culinary institution or related experience preferred.
	
		Literary skills and oral proficiency in the English language.
	
		Ability to multi-task and handle high-pressure situations.

	 

	The Work Environment:

		Standard restaurant, kitchen, banquet, and room service setting.
	
		Continuous walking and standing on varied floor surfaces for 8 or more hours at a time.
	
		Occasional lifting and carrying of 50 lb. trays, crates, or boxes.
	
		Occasional lifting and carrying trays over the shoulder.
	
		Continuous operation of pushing a room service cart, lifting and carrying hot boxes, rolling or carrying banquet tables, stacking and loading carts of banquet chairs, and miscellaneous hand and elbow movements.
	
		Professional, passionate and positive environment provided through excellent communication and teamwork amongst the entire staff and company.

full_description: The Bartender plays a leading role in developing positive, lasting guest relationships by consistently delivering an excellent bar experience in our restaurants. As the direct link between the guest and the restaurant, it is primarily the Bartender’s responsibility to ensure that each guest enjoys all aspects of their experience. All Chili's employees are held to high expectations; it is the bartender’s responsibility to know the drinks/ingredients and restaurant menus inside and out, play an integral part in the financial results of the position, contribute to running side-work, and be self-motivated to go above and beyond our set of standards. The Bartender is aware of, and complies with, state/federal/corporate liquor laws through age verification and termination alcohol consumption of seemingly intoxicated individuals. The ideal Bartender is at least 19 years of age, has a high school diploma /GED, and a minimum of 2 years like volume bartending experience.   The following is a representative list of the duties and responsibilities associated with this position:   -- Know and follow all policies, standards & procedures  -- Welcome and greet guests  -- Make all guests feel comfortable and let them know you’re there to personally take care of them  -- Know regular guests by name, their preferences and their needs  -- Circulate through the assigned bar area on a continuous basis to provide superior guest service  -- Know the brands of beer, wine and liquor offered for consumption, as well as the ingredients to the most commonly asked for cocktails, the garnishes they require, the proper glassware, and price  -- Inform guests of specialty drinks  -- Make recommendations you genuinely feel your guests will enjoy  -- Answer questions about our food, beverages, and other restaurant functions and services  -- Receive and understand beverage orders and repeat them to the guests and/or servers and enter orders in the point-of-sale system -- Deliver drink orders according to appropriate  guidelines to each guest and cocktail server in a timely and efficient manner  -- Maintain cash bank and follow established cash handling procedures  -- Follow and practice all alcoholic beverage laws, policies and regulations -- Continuously watch for signs of intoxication for the protection and enjoyment of all guests -- Perform side work at the start and end of each shift as required  -- Maintain a clean and safe work area and clean section at all times, free from dirty glassware, plastic cups, beer bottles  -- Polish all glasses  -- Clean and maintain reach-in coolers and fixtures in bar area  -- Perform and document physical inventory counts at direction of general manager or restaurant manager  -- Monitor and observe guest’s experience  -- Ensure guests are satisfied with service  -- Respond promptly and courteously to any requests  -- Prepare final bill, present check to guest, accept payment, process credit card charges or make change (if applicable)  -- Thank guests for their visit and invite them to return  -- Participate in proactive communication to help avoid and solve operational, HR, and financial issues  -- Be available to fill in as needed to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the bar as directed by the restaurant manager or immediate supervisor

full_description:
*** Production, Drivers, Maintenance, Security Guards, Bartenders ***
*** Warehouse, Shipping, Receiving, Forklift, Delivery *** 
*** General Laborers, Installers, Dispatchers *** 
GET PAID WHILE TRAINING FOR A NEW CAREER!
Examinetics, Inc. is the nation's largest Occupational Health Screening Company. 
Approximately 10 weeks off per year with pay!
Paid expenses, full benefits, 401k and more.
On-the-Job-Training. 
Approximate average salary of $31,600 - $36,000 per year. 
$2,500. First Year Anniversary Bonus.
Travel, meet new people, and have new experiences while working as an audiometric and respiratory fit test technician. Duties include setting up and calibrating equipment and administering and assuring tests are valid and complete. The OHS is also responsible for driving the 26 ft. mobile unit and keeping the mobile unit in good working order by conducting daily routine maintenance checks. Service-oriented individuals needed for jobs to provide top-notch service to clients on-site.
The OHS is expected to work independently in the field.
Must be able to work approximately up to 50 hours per week. 
Must be at least 21 years old and possess a valid driver's license with a good record. 
Computer skills, a positive attitude and customer service skills required. 
Must be able to lift and unwind up to 50 lbs. 
Must pass a drug screen, DOT physical, and background check (paid for by Examinetics). 
The following are not required, but are great attributes: Bilingual English/Spanish & CDL license. 
Examinetics participates in the U.S. Online Employment Eligibility Verification System. By the third day of employment, Examinetics confirms all new hires are authorized by the Government to work in the USA.   EEO

*** General Laborers, Installers, Dispatchers ***

full_description:
Job Description  

 We need a new barista to join our team! If you are passionate about coffee, espresso and latte art and want to get involved with our rapidly growing company, please apply today!
 Job Title: Barista/Bartender
 Eataly's Caffe LaVazza is a traditional Italian espresso bar inside of New York's busiest Italian marketplace. We feature LaVazza espresso, beautiful cappuccini, an array of LaVazza's signature drinks along with wine, beer, spirits and house-made pastries. We are seeking an experienced barista who is energetic, friendly, and understands the graceful dance of high-volume Italian coffee service. Minimum one year of high-volume experience with a MANUAL espresso machine is required. Please know how to grind, measure, tamp and pull beautiful shots of espresso and make silky foam.
 Candidates must meet ALL of the following requirements to be considered:
 -MINIMUM 1 YEAR RECENT HIGH-VOLUME EXPERIENCE WITH MANUAL ESPRESSO MACHINE. We will test you!
 -LATTE ART - Show us what you can do! Hearts? Leaves?
 -Customer service oriented
 -Team-player
 -Italian language skills a plus!

 As an ambassador of Eataly products and services, the Barista is responsible for helping to create and maintain quality and healthy experiences for each guest that comes to Eataly. Eataly ambassadors are expected to actively engage with guests and spend quality time with each customer.
        

      
Skills/Requirements 

 Minimum Qualifications:

 -Must have knowledge of all forms of coffee and its related forms, and be familiar with standard drink recipes.
 -Must possess basic math skills and have the ability to handle money.
 -High school graduate desired or equivalent.
 -Must have ability to remain stationary for long periods of up to four hours in length.
 -Must be able to cheerfully communicate with bar patrons.

summary: Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards, anticipate and address guests' service needs, and thank guests with genuine appreciation....
Our philosophy at Ameristar Casinos is to proudly deliver a quality customer experience in a fun and friendly atmosphere, while working together to provide our...
full_description:
Guest Service Requirement
					Our philosophy at Ameristar Casinos is to proudly deliver a quality customer experience in a fun and friendly atmosphere, while working together to provide our team members with personal and professional growth opportunities. Because of this philosophy, it is critical that all team members understand the importance of excellent guest service. All of our positions, whether corporate, back of house, management, or front of house require a friendly persona and a willingness to interact and provide fun, professional and friendly guest service. Guests are not our only customers; fellow team members are our internal customers as well. By joining the Ameristar team, you are committing yourself to these values and acknowledging your dedication to providing excellent guest service for our guests and our internal team, at all times.Safety Requirement:
					Safety is a core value at Ameristar Casinos. The ability to work safely and prevent personal injury is a key job requirement of every position. Each Team Member is also expected to be committed to the safety of fellow Team Members and our guests and demonstrate that commitment through daily actions.Position Summary
					To mix and serve alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks to patrons of bar. 
					Must be able to work varied shifts and varied days off, including weekends and holiday periods. Mix and serve alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks to patrons. Learn all beverage and wine lists, including daily specials. Learn and follow all beverage recipes and adhere to the established pour policy. Operate within full compliance of liquor laws and regulations. Adhere to and enforce all control systems. Process orders through cash register. Learn prices of all drinks. Collect payment and promptly settle all cash and charge transactions. Requisition liquor and other supplies, when needed with supervisor's approval. Keep bar area clean and organized at all times and prepared for on-coming shift. Inform supervisor of guests who appear to be intoxicated. Ask for identification of all suspected under-age patrons.

COMING SOON
Located in the heart of Chicago's Noble Square, Unite Urban Grill is the creation of husband and wife team Joe and Megan Krouse. Inspiration for the restaurant comes from Joe and Megan's love for diverse cuisines. As a health conscious yogi, Megan has a special place in her palette for fresh vegetables and grains. Joe is a meat lover; before he met Megan there were only two food groups, "meat and no thanks." But through their love of food, the pair teamed up with renowned Executive Chef Bradford Phillips to Unite taste buds.
Unite Urban Grill offers an accessible menu with quality seasonal ingredients and fresh grilled items. From the contemporary dining room to the open-air lounge and patio, guests can enjoy their meal in a relaxed and comfortable environment. The full bar features local craft beers, wine, and specialty cocktails. Unite Urban Grill is open Tuesday through Sunday for dinner and Sunday for brunch. Walk-ins and reservations welcome.
We are seeking a talented mixologist to join our opening team! Your responsibilities will include creating our specialty drinks, assisting management in selecting spirits, inventory and training. This is a great opportunity for a confident, experienced candidate to take their game to the next level!

summary: You must have a minimum of a high school diploma or GED. Only Green card holders or US Citizens can be considered for these positions....
full_description: Consider the following requirements carefully before attending our Employment Information Sessions and/or applying to this opportunity! You must have a minimum of 1 year current/recent/relevant experience to any of the positions listed in our description above.     You must have a minimum of a high school diploma or GED   EMPLOYMENT CONDITIONS: Only Green card holders or US Citizens can be considered for these positions. Any employment offer for NCL America is contingent on the ability of the applicant, candidate and/or new hire to successfully apply for and obtain a United States Coast Guard Merchant Mariner Credential (MMC) prior to ship assignment start date. The application process with the Coast Guard will require disclosure of previous employment, drug testing and medical, criminal and court records to include DUI's, sealed records, and suspended licenses. IMPORTANT REQUIREMENT FOR ALL APPLICANTS: You must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and qualify for a U.S. Coast Guard Merchant Mariner Credential (MMC). In order to qualify for an MMC you must: Be at least 18 years of age Be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident Alien Pass Physical Exam/Drug Screen Have a Reasonably Clear BackgroundMust be able to read, write and speak English fluently

Inspect linen, silver, china and other table items for cleanliness and appearance.														Serve food, coffee, water and other beverages to customers as required by guests. 														Cooperate closely with other members of the outlet team including servers, porters and kitchen associates. 														Run food to tables and clearly explain the composition of each dish in details with proper language.														Assist bartenders with bar set up and equipment/product replenishment.														Clear and reset tables as needed. 														Communicate with Restaurant Management on a daily basis. 														Clean restaurant area during and after meal periods. 														Positive team player with the ability to get larger tasks completed. 														Acquire a working knowledge of the hotel, in house facilities and local information to respond to customer inquiries about the area. 														Follow health and safety procedures.														Work well in a team atmosphere and independently. 														Self-motivated and friendly, able to work with a diverse team of people.														Attend monthly department meetings. 														Perform general cleaning tasks using standard hotel cleaning products as assigned by your supervisor to adhere to health standards. 														Perform other duties and responsibilities as requested e.g., special guest requests.														Must adhere to All State, Federal and Corporate liquor regulations pertaining to serving alcoholic beverages to minors and intoxicated guests to insure all laws are being followed.														Report to duty as scheduled by direct supervisor according to operating hours.														Provide maximum levels of guest service while maintaining Langham Hospitality Group standards.														Be fully versed in all Forbes service standards.														Other duties as assigned by direct supervisor.																PHYSICAL DEMANDS:								Considerable repetitive motion of hands and wrists as pertaining to pouring of drinks from bottles and shaking with shakers. 		Standing for 90% of work shift is required		Activities include standing, reaching, bending, pushing, pulling, handling, grasping, lifting, carrying, seeing, hearing, talking, walking. Prior experience in fine dining restaurant 				Requires the ability to lift and carry object weighing up to 50 pounds. 				Standing for 90% of work shift is required. Basic English language writing skills necessary for completion of requisitions, balance sheets and vouchers. Ability to work stand and work in confined spaces for long periods of time. 				Ability to operate beverage equipment: coffeemaker, iced tea machine, etc. 												EDUCATION REQUIRED:								Any combination of education and experience equivalent to graduation from high school or any other combination of education, training or experience that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities. 		High school diploma preferred.												EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:								Prior Food and Beverage experience required. full_description:
Job Description

					
					WORK IS MORE FUN ON THE WATER! 
WE ARE NOW HIRING BARTENDERS FOR OUR BOATS AT NAVY PIER.
Come join the Entertainment Cruises crew and WOW our guests. No experience is required – you just need to be committed to excellence. 
What We Do:
Entertainment Cruises provides spectacular, 2-3 hour boat excursions in America’s most exciting port cities – New York, Chicago, Washington DC, Boston, Baltimore, Philadelphia and Norfolk VA. Guests come aboard to celebrate the special moments of their life. Our maritime crew makes sure that we create unforgettable memories for our guests and shipmates by ensuring that each cruise is a safe and enjoyable experience. 
ABOUT THE JOB:
Inspired by a commitment to excellence, the service team at our Company* creates unforgettable memories for our guests.  The successful bartender mixes high-quality beverages, provides prompt and consistent service at guest and service bars, is hospitable and cordial to guests and coworkers, acts safely and responsibly, and is knowledgeable about the vessel and the skyline.
ABOUT OUR PEOPLE:
Our people make the difference. O.S.S. (Our Service System) helps us to create the best possible work environment and provide outstanding guest service. Our shipmates are dynamic, upbeat, and friendly. Our core values emphasize respect for one another, teamwork, innovation, personal responsibility, and honest communication. And above all, our most important obligation is to think and work safely. 
We recognize our shipmates for a job well done. Our shipmate appreciation program includes weekly heroes and monthly MVP’s.
And there is plenty of opportunity to advance. More than 60% of our on-board managers were promoted from within. Each position has the opportunity to learn skills that will qualify them for future management positions. 
Come be a part of the premier team in this exciting industry. We offer competitive pay and flexible work environment.

					
					
					
					Markets: Chicago. Job Categories: Bar. Job Types: Part-Time. Job expires in 28 days.

Demonstrate team work by co-operating and assisting colleagues as needed.
Complies with occupational, health, and safety standards.

Strictly adheres to corporate and government mandated sanitation and general cleanliness standards.

Strictly follows prescribed hygiene procedures for food handling and sanitation.
Sets up workstation based on pars established by Chef and by following station set-up sheets.
Tests cooked foods by tasting and smelling them
Insures foods are stored and kept at proper holding temperatures, through the use of thermometers.
Attends regularly scheduled staff meetings.
Completes all closing requirements as directed by Chef and/or Sous Chef.
Follows guidelines as outlined in the Company Handbook.
Performs such other duties as may be assigned
Requirements & Skills
        Able to work nights and weekends.

			Aloha Eats kitchen help
		
	


        Experienced? Reliable and consistent? We are Chicago's only Hawaiian "local style" restaurant and we need extra help in our kitchen! Our menu is pretty small and things are pretty easy to do for someone who has spent time in the back of the house, but you must be comfortable in a busy kitchen.
Primary duties:
frying
cleaning/mopping/washing
prep work/plating
Secondary duties:
cutting (vegetables and meat)
grilling
occasional heavy lifting
AVAILABILITY: We may need you as early as 10 and closing is usually pretty quick (most nights finished by 10:30). 20-25 hours +/- (4-5 shifts) a week depending on the help we can find. May become a full-time position depending on our situation and how well you handle our style of kitchen. Must have an open availability. Weekends are NECESSARY. We're close to DePaul (10 minute walk from main campus) and we're right at #22 and #36 bus stop.
You must have prior kitchen experience before we will consider your application. Otherwise, you cannot be considered.
Mahalo! (Thanks!)

·         Eighth grade education or the equivalent, required.
·         Six months experience in a dietary related position, preferred. 
·         One to three months of on-the-job training, required. 
·         Knowledge of dietary practices and procedures, preferred.
This position reports directly to the Dining Service Supervisor, is service in nature, and shall also take direction from the Campus Dining Services Director, Production Manager or Cook. In performance of duties, the Dietary Aide sets dining rooms with appropriate tableware, disposables, and condiments. Serves meals to residents at the proper meal time by dishing up and serving food in the appropriate dining area. Monitors temperatures of food and refrigeration in dining areas. Makes coffee, proportions beverages, and places on appropriate tray or food cart. Assists on line as directed. Transports food to the Axelson kitchen. Maintains appropriate portion control by using correct utensils. Clears tables by removing dishes and garbage. Wipes tables and chairs after each meal service. Scrapes food from dishes, sorts and stacks tableware, and transports to the Dish room.
Receives and retrieves tableware from dining areas, scrapes remaining food from dishware. Sorts, stacks, and operates the dish machine to wash and sanitize eating utensils. Monitors the water temperatures and cleaning compound usage. Keeps all kitchen work areas and dining rooms clean and clear of dirty dishes. Transports inspected clean and dry tableware to the proper area. Receives pots, pans, and cooking utensils. Scrapes food from the surfaces, soaks as needed, washes and sanitizes. Returns cleaned pots and pans to their proper storage/place of use. Cleans equipment, appliances, etc. as scheduled by the manager/ supervisor. Performs other cleaning assignments as directed all in accordance with policy and procedure for proper sanitation. Sweeps and mops floors. Assists in the transportation of residents in case of fire, disaster, or emergency evacuation according to procedure.
The individual must be able to communicate effectively in English, oral and written, with residents, family members, and staff (ie. Reading of meal cards and seating charts). Must possess good interpersonal skills, project a friendly personality, and understand customer service and team building concepts. Demonstrates flexibility and patience in understanding the needs of the aging senior. Initiative and the ability to follow through are essential. Good observational skills are required.
Join a faith-based organization dedicated to excellence in customer service to our residents. For more information about Covenant Retirement Communities, please visit www.covenantretirement.org.
DISCOVER the possibilities…qualified candidates should send a cover letter and current resume to: Alice Raflores, Human Resources Director, Covenant Village of Northbrook, 2625 Techny Rd. Northbrook, IL 60062; fax (847) 412-7318, email jobs.CV.Northbrook@covenantretirement.org,
Covenant Retirement Communities is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

        Directly responsible for all kitchen functions including menu management, food purchasing, preparation and maintenance of quality standards; sanitation and cleanliness; training of employees in methods of cooking, preparation, plate presentation, portion and cost control and sanitation and cleanliness.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Ensure that all food and products are consistently prepared and served according to the restaurant's recipes, portioning, cooking and serving standards.
Make employment and termination decisions including interviewing, hiring, evaluating and disciplining kitchen personnel as appropriate.
Provide orientation of company and department rules, policies and procedures and oversee training of new kitchen employees.
Fill in where needed to ensure guest service standards and efficient operations.
Prepare all required paperwork, including forms, reports and schedules in an organized and timely manner.
Ensure that all equipment is kept clean and kept in excellent working condition through personal inspection and by following the restaurant's preventative maintenance programs.
Work with restaurant managers to plan and price menu items. Establish portion sizes and prepare standard recipe cards for all new menu items.
Ensure that all products are ordered according to predetermined product specifications and received in correct unit count and condition and deliveries are performed in accordance with the restaurant's receiving policies and procedures.
Control food cost and usage by following proper requisition of products from storage areas, product storage procedures, standard recipes and waste control procedures.
Oversee and ensure that restaurant policies on employee performance appraisals are followed and completed on a timely basis.
Schedule labor as required by anticipated business activity while ensuring that all positions are staffed when and as needed and labor cost objectives are met.
Be knowledgeable of restaurant policies regarding personnel and administer prompt, fair and consistent corrective action for any and all violations of company policies, rules and procedures.
Oversee the training of kitchen personnel in safe operation of all kitchen equipment and utensils.
Responsible for training kitchen personnel in cleanliness and sanitation practices.
Responsible for maintaining appropriate cleaning schedules for kitchen floors, mats, walls, hoods, other equipment and food storage areas.
Check and maintain proper food holding and refrigeration temperature control points.
Provide safety training in first aid, CPR, lifting and carrying objects and handling hazardous materials.
 
Qualifications:
A minimum of 3 years of experience in varied kitchen positions including food preparation, line cook, fry cook and expediter.
At least 1 year experience in a similar capacity.
Must be able to communicate clearly with managers, kitchen and dining room personnel and guests.
Be able to reach, bend, stoop and frequently lift up to 50 pounds.
Be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 9 hours).

        Duties & Responsibilities: SS Prepares a variety of meats, seafood, poultry, vegetables and other food items using Mediterranean recipes for cooking in broilers, ovens, grills, fryers and a variety of other kitchen equipment. SS Assumes 100% responsibility for quality of products served. SS Knows and complies consistently with our standard portion sizes, cooking methods, quality standards and kitchen rules, policies and procedures. SS Stocks and maintains sufficient levels of food products at line stations to assure a smooth service period. SS Portions food products prior to cooking according to standard portion sizes and recipe specifications. SS Maintains a clean and sanitary work station area including tables, shelves, grills, broilers, fryers, pasta cookers, saute burners, convection oven, flat top range and refrigeration equipment. SS Prepares item for broiling, grilling, frying, sauteing or other cooking methods by portioning, battering, breading, seasoning and/or marinating. SS Follows proper plate presentation and garnish set up for all dishes. SS Handles, stores and rotates all products properly. SS Completes required tasks within assigned time frames. SS Tracks and reports any food waste. SS Assists in food prep assignments during off-peak periods as needed. SS Opens and/or closes the kitchen properly and follows the closing checklist for kitchen stations. Assists others in closing the kitchen. SS Cooks only items generated from the restaurant point-of-sale system SS Performs related duties such as helping to wash dishes as needed, preparing recycling, cleaning around restaurant and help with any other projects as assigned by the kitchen manager. SS If a meal is returned for any reason, correct the problem and report the return to the manager. SS Attends all scheduled employee meetings and brings suggestions for improvement. SS Performs other related duties as assigned by the manager-on-duty. Qualifications: SS A minimum of 2 years of experience is required SS Must be able to communicate clearly with managers, kitchen and dining room personnel. SS Be able to reach, bend, stoop and frequently lift up to 40 pounds. SS Be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 9 hours).

summary: SS Prepares a variety of meats, seafood, poultry, vegetables and other food items using Mediterranean recipes for cooking in broilers, ovens, grills, fryers and...
full_description: Duties & Responsibilities: SS Prepares a variety of meats, seafood, poultry, vegetables and other food items using Mediterranean recipes for cooking in broilers, ovens, grills, fryers and a variety of other kitchen equipment. SS Assumes 100% responsibility for quality of products served. SS Knows and complies consistently with our standard portion sizes, cooking methods, quality standards and kitchen rules, policies and procedures. SS Stocks and maintains sufficient levels of food products at line stations to assure a smooth service period. SS Portions food products prior to cooking according to standard portion sizes and recipe specifications. SS Maintains a clean and sanitary work station area including tables, shelves, grills, broilers, fryers, pasta cookers, saute burners, convection oven, flat top range and refrigeration equipment. SS Prepares item for broiling, grilling, frying, sauteing or other cooking methods by portioning, battering, breading, seasoning and/or marinating. SS Follows proper plate presentation and garnish set up for all dishes. SS Handles, stores and rotates all products properly. SS Completes required tasks within assigned time frames. SS Tracks and reports any food waste. SS Assists in food prep assignments during off-peak periods as needed. SS Opens and/or closes the kitchen properly and follows the closing checklist for kitchen stations. Assists others in closing the kitchen. SS Cooks only items generated from the restaurant point-of-sale system SS Performs related duties such as helping to wash dishes as needed, preparing recycling, cleaning around restaurant and help with any other projects as assigned by the kitchen manager. SS If a meal is returned for any reason, correct the problem and report the return to the manager. SS Attends all scheduled employee meetings and brings suggestions for improvement. SS Performs other related duties as assigned by the manager-on-duty. Qualifications: SS A minimum of 2 years of experience is required SS Must be able to communicate clearly with managers, kitchen and dining room personnel. SS Be able to reach, bend, stoop and frequently lift up to 40 pounds. SS Be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 9 hours).
